page.title: 08KILTARLITY'S POSTMASTER
page.content: Don Cameron is the{Postmaster}in Kiltarlity.The sub-post office is also a newsagents and confectioners.Don's post round covers the outskirts of the village, takes him out of the parish at Struy bridge and goes all the way up Glen Strathfarrar,which has only 7 houses on 25km of road.In such a remote area,Don is often the only human contact people have with the outside world in a day.He often delivers medicines,pensions,stamps and even milk.Don's day starts at 6am.His work includes sorting newspapers and mail,delivering these,serving in the shop and doing accounts.The most unusual mail he has had to deliver was a salmon which just had a label tied to it's tail.Don is the treasurer of Kiltarlity Community Council and a keen gardener in his spare time.
